programme.title: Detektyw w sutannie 3 (odc. 16)
programme.desc: Ksiądz Frank Dowling (Tom Bosley) wciela się w rolę prywatnego detektywa. Jego nieodłączną towarzyszką jest zakonnica Steve (Tracy Nelson), która pomaga wytropić każdego przestępcę i rozwiązać najbardziej skomplikowane, kryminalne zagadki. Ich działalność sprawia, że oboje niejednokrotnie znajdują się w centrum niebezpiecznych wydarzeń. Na plebanii parafii św. Michała mają zatrzymać się czterej zdobywcy medalu za służbę duszpasterską. Pojawia się trzech, jeden zostaje znaleziony martwy. Wkrótce ginie kolejny. Następny ma być ksiądz Dowling.(c)

programme.title: Detektyw w sutannie 3 (odc. 17)
programme.desc: Ksiądz Frank Dowling (Tom Bosley) wciela się w rolę prywatnego detektywa. Jego nieodłączną towarzyszką jest zakonnica Steve (Tracy Nelson), która pomaga wytropić każdego przestępcę i rozwiązać najbardziej skomplikowane, kryminalne zagadki. Ich działalność sprawia, że oboje niejednokrotnie znajdują się w centrum niebezpiecznych wydarzeń. Tuż po otwarciu wystawy egipskich eksponatów w muzeum umiera kustosz działu starożytności, doktor Tom Douglas. Mężczyzna był przyjacielem księdza Dowlinga. Detektyw i siostra Stephanie próbują wyjaśnić sprawę jego tajemniczej śmierci.(c)

programme.title: Detektyw w sutannie 3 (odc. 18)
programme.desc: Ksiądz Frank Dowling (Tom Bosley) wciela się w rolę prywatnego detektywa. Jego nieodłączną towarzyszką jest zakonnica Steve (Tracy Nelson), która pomaga wytropić każdego przestępcę i rozwiązać najbardziej skomplikowane, kryminalne zagadki. Ich działalność sprawia, że oboje niejednokrotnie znajdują się w centrum niebezpiecznych wydarzeń. Przebywający w zoo ulubieniec siostry Steve, szympans Diogenes, ma kłopoty. Jest podejrzany o spowodowanie śmierci jednego z pracowników zoo. Siostra Steve nie wierzy w jego winę i postanawia zbadać tę sprawę.(c)

programme.title: Detektyw w sutannie 3 (odc. 19)
programme.desc: Ksiądz Frank Dowling (Tom Bosley) wciela się w rolę prywatnego detektywa. Jego nieodłączną towarzyszką jest zakonnica Steve (Tracy Nelson), która pomaga wytropić każdego przestępcę i rozwiązać najbardziej skomplikowane, kryminalne zagadki. Ich działalność sprawia, że oboje niejednokrotnie znajdują się w centrum niebezpiecznych wydarzeń. Przyjaciel księdza Dowlinga, Rich Vincent, pisze książkę. Jego bohaterami są ksiądz i zakonnica, którzy podobnie jak ksiądz Dowling i siostra Steve rozwiązują kryminalne zagadki. Niespodziewanie pisarz zostaje zamordowany. Detektyw w sutannie próbuje odnaleźć jego zabójcę.(c)

programme.title: Detektyw w sutannie 3 (odc. 20)
programme.desc: Ksiądz Frank Dowling (Tom Bosley) wciela się w rolę prywatnego detektywa. Jego nieodłączną towarzyszką jest zakonnica Steve (Tracy Nelson), która pomaga wytropić każdego przestępcę i rozwiązać najbardziej skomplikowane, kryminalne zagadki. Ich działalność sprawia, że oboje niejednokrotnie znajdują się w centrum niebezpiecznych wydarzeń. Ksiądz Dowling, siostra Steve i ksiądz Prestwick udają się na konferencję do Los Angeles. Przy tej okazji zakonnica postanawia spotkać się z Maksem Donovanem, ojcem pewnej nastolatki, która za nim bardzo tęskni. Mężczyzna pracuje dla gwiazdy rocka - Laurie Kidd. Zostaje oskarżony o zamordowanie jej przyjaciela. Duchowni postanawiają dowiedzieć się czy rzeczywiście to on jest mordercą.(c)

programme.title: Miłość, kłamstwa i morderstwo (odc. 1)
programme.desc: Dochodzi do zabójstwa, w wyniku którego ginie gospodyni domowa. Do zbrodni przyznaje się jej niezrównoważona córka. Sprawa wydaje się prosta jednak policjanci prowadzący dochodzenie nie potrafią ustalić motywów zbrodni. Śledztwo przeciąga się w czasie, a zagadka morderstwa nadal pozostaje niewyjaśniona. Film zrealizowany na podstawie książki "If You Really Loved Me" autorstwa Ann Rule.(c)

programme.title: Miłość, kłamstwa i morderstwo (odc. 2)
programme.desc: Dochodzi do zabójstwa, w wyniku którego ginie gospodyni domowa. Do zbrodni przyznaje się jej niezrównoważona córka. Sprawa wydaje się prosta jednak policjanci prowadzący dochodzenie nie potrafią ustalić motywów zbrodni. Śledztwo przeciąga się w czasie, a zagadka morderstwa nadal pozostaje niewyjaśniona. Film zrealizowany na podstawie książki "If You Really Loved Me" autorstwa Ann Rule.(c)

programme.title: Zła znajomość
programme.desc: Wdowa Susan Walker (Mercedes Ruehl) samotnie wychowuje dwójkę dzieci, dziesięcioletnią Hannah i młodszego Maksa. Pewnego razu poznaje przystojnego Russella (Alex Carter), który wydaje się jej doskonałym kandydatem na męża i ojca jej pociech. Troskliwy i opiekuńczy mężczyzna szybko zdobywa jej zaufanie i sympatię rodzeństwa. Gdy okazuje się, że zajmuje się on handlem narkotykami, zdesperowana Susan porzuca go, nie zważając na obietnice, że zerwie z nielegalnym procederem. Pewnego razu dom kobiety szturmuje policja, a ona zostaje aresztowana pod zarzutem współudziału w rozprowadzaniu marihuany. Podczas procesu koledzy Russella - udając współpracę z wymiarem sprawiedliwości, by w ten sposób uzyskać łagodniejszą karę - zeznają przeciwko niewinnej matce. W konsekwencji Susan zostaje skazana na dwudziestoletni pobyt w więzieniu. Rozpoczyna długoletnią walkę o anulowanie niesprawiedliwego wyroku.(c)

programme.title: Strefa mroku 3 (odc. 24)
programme.desc: Losy zwykłych ludzi, którzy zetknęli się ze zjawiskami paranormalnymi. W każdym odcinku opowiedziana zostanie jedna przerażająca historia.(c)

programme.title: Dom grozy 3 (odc. 2)
programme.desc: Osamotniona Vanessa Ives (Eva Green) pogrąża się w depresji i zmuszona jest szukać pomocy u tajemniczej doktor Seward (Patti LuPone). Aresztowany rewolwerowiec Ethan Chandler (Josh Hartnett) udaje się pod policyjną eskortą w rodzinne strony, gdzie ma być sądzony za swoje zbrodnie. Sir Malcolm Murray (Timothy Dalton) przebywa w Afryce Wschodniej. Mężczyzna przybył tam, żeby pochować starego przyjaciela i znaleźć nowy cel w życiu. Doktora Frankensteina (Harry Treadaway) odwiedza dawny znajomy Henry Jekyll (Shazad Latif). Trzeci sezonu serialu, który opowiada o mrocznych sekretach wiktoriańskiego Londynu i jego mieszkańców. Łączy w sobie elementy horroru i psychologicznego dramatu. Twórcy bardzo starannie oddali też realia epoki. Pomysłodawcą produkcji jest zdobywca trzech nominacji do Oscara John Logan (scen. "Gladiator\.(c)

programme.title: Extant: Przetrwanie (odc. 7)
programme.desc: Molly Woods (Halle Berry) pracuje jako astronautka w ISEA, prowadząc ściśle tajne eksperymenty. Kobieta wraca na Ziemię po 13 miesiącach spędzonych samotnie na pokładzie stacji kosmicznej Seraphim. Teraz próbuje na nowo wieść normalne życie ze swoją rodziną. Jej mąż John (Goran Višnjić) jest utalentowanym naukowcem i konstruktorem, który tworzy androidy. Jednym z nich jest Ethan (Pierce Gagnon), którego para wychowuje jak syna. Chłopiec został zaprojektowany jako model prototypowy. Wkrótce po powrocie okazuje się, że Molly jest w ciąży. Wydaje się to nieprawdopodobne, gdyż kobieta musiałaby w nią zajść podczas misji. Spokojne życie Woodsów komplikują także problemy Molly z pamięcią.(n)

programme.title: Chaos (odc. 1)
programme.desc: Serial ukazujący pracę agentów CIA z wydziału Tajnych Służb i Kontroli (angielski skrót: CHAOS), którzy borykają się z biurokracją, niekompetencją i nieudolnością polityków. Po utracie swojej dotychczasowej posady, agent Centralnej Agencji Wywiadowczej (CIA) Rick Martinez, zostaje przydzielony do tajnej sekcji specjalnej. Mężczyzna ma za zadanie zostać szpiclem dyrekcji i szpiegować kolegów z pracy, którzy dopuszczają się wykroczeń. Niestety nowi znajomi szybko demaskują zamiary szpiega i postanawiają zabawić się jego kosztem.(c)

programme.title: Nieśmiertelny 5 (odc. 13)
programme.desc: 5. seria przygód szkockiego wojownika Duncana MacLeoda obdarzonego nieśmiertelnością członka klanu Connorów, któremu grozi nieustanne niebezpieczeństwo, zarówno ze strony innych nieśmiertelnych jak i tajemniczej społeczności Obserwatorów. Bractwo śmiertelnych nadal nastaje na jego życie, a mężczyzna jest ich priorytetowym celem, któremu poprzysięgli okrutną śmierć. Richie udaje amerykańskiego milionera. Zostaje porwany przez czarującą Francuzkę, która potrzebuje 200 tysięcy franków na ratowanie rodzinnego zamku.(c)

programme.title: Nieśmiertelny 5 (odc. 14)
programme.desc: 5. seria przygód szkockiego wojownika Duncana MacLeoda obdarzonego nieśmiertelnością członka klanu Connorów, któremu grozi nieustanne niebezpieczeństwo, zarówno ze strony innych nieśmiertelnych jak i tajemniczej społeczności Obserwatorów. Bractwo śmiertelnych nadal nastaje na jego życie, a mężczyzna jest ich priorytetowym celem, któremu poprzysięgli okrutną śmierć. W 1971 roku nieśmiertelny Octavio Consone zabił narzeczonego Anny i ojca jej nienarodzonego dziecka. Teraz interesuje się dorosłym już dzieckiem.(c)

programme.title: Nieśmiertelny 5 (odc. 15)
programme.desc: 5. seria przygód szkockiego wojownika Duncana MacLeoda obdarzonego nieśmiertelnością członka klanu Connorów, któremu grozi nieustanne niebezpieczeństwo, zarówno ze strony innych nieśmiertelnych jak i tajemniczej społeczności Obserwatorów. Bractwo śmiertelnych nadal nastaje na jego życie, a mężczyzna jest ich priorytetowym celem, któremu poprzysięgli okrutną śmierć. Duncan wspomina, jak podstępem skłoniono go do pomocy w kradzieży brytyjskich klejnotów koronnych. Tym razem to on wciąga Amandę w kradzież Kamienia za Scone, aby odwieźć go do Szkocji.(c)

programme.title: Nieśmiertelny 5 (odc. 16)
programme.desc: 5. seria przygód szkockiego wojownika Duncana MacLeoda obdarzonego nieśmiertelnością członka klanu Connorów, któremu grozi nieustanne niebezpieczeństwo, zarówno ze strony innych nieśmiertelnych jak i tajemniczej społeczności Obserwatorów. Bractwo śmiertelnych nadal nastaje na jego życie, a mężczyzna jest ich priorytetowym celem, któremu poprzysięgli okrutną śmierć. W Paryżu Duncan odkrywa, że jest ścigany przez nieśmiertelnego Stevena Keane'a. Jest to konsekwencją jego udziału w powstaniu jakobickim w latach 1745-1746.(c)

programme.title: Nieśmiertelny 5 (odc. 17)
programme.desc: 5. seria przygód szkockiego wojownika Duncana MacLeoda obdarzonego nieśmiertelnością członka klanu Connorów, któremu grozi nieustanne niebezpieczeństwo, zarówno ze strony innych nieśmiertelnych jak i tajemniczej społeczności Obserwatorów. Bractwo śmiertelnych nadal nastaje na jego życie, a mężczyzna jest ich priorytetowym celem, któremu poprzysięgli okrutną śmierć. Duncan wspomina spotkanie z lordem Byronem i małżeństwem Shelleyów. Wówczas to mimowolnie zainspirował on Mary Shelley do napisania szkicu późniejszej powieści o Frankensteinie.(c)

programme.title: Zdrówko! 5 (odc. 20)
programme.desc: Sam Malone (Ted Danson), była gwiazda baseballu, prowadzi mały, spokojny bar w Bostonie. Spotykają się w nim stali goście m.in.: Norm Peterson (George Wendt), Cliff Calvin (John Ratzenberger), dr Frasier Crane (Kelsey Grammer). Spędzają w barze kilka godzin dziennie rozmawiając o swoich problemach.(c)

programme.title: Zdrówko! 5 (odc. 21)
programme.desc: Sam Malone (Ted Danson), była gwiazda baseballu, prowadzi mały, spokojny bar w Bostonie. Spotykają się w nim stali goście m.in.: Norm Peterson (George Wendt), Cliff Calvin (John Ratzenberger), dr Frasier Crane (Kelsey Grammer). Spędzają w barze kilka godzin dziennie rozmawiając o swoich problemach.(c)

programme.title: Ulice San Francisco 4 (odc. 11)
programme.desc: Czwarty sezon przygód pary niezwykłych detektywów z wydziału zabójstw. Doświadczony porucznik Mike Stone (Karl Malden)policjant z dwudziestoletnim stażem zawodowym, współpracuje z inspektorem Stevem Kellerem (Michael Douglas), który pod jego okiem zaznajamia się ze specyfiką pracy policyjnego śledczego. Wspólnie przemierzają niebezpieczne ulice San Francisco, tropiąc groźnych przestępców.(c)

programme.title: Wzór (odc. 3)
programme.desc: W Los Angeles dochodzi do zagadkowych przypadków śmierci. Publiczna służba zdrowia zwraca się do Dona i jego zespołu o pomoc w ustaleniu przyczyny zgonów. Istnieje bowiem obawa, że może to być efekt działania broni biologicznej. Agenci FBI próbują powstrzymać rozprzestrzenienie się wirusa, a także ustalić, kto chce wywołać epidemię. Korzystają przy tym z matematycznej wiedzy Charliego. W trakcie dochodzenia Don dowiaduje się, że jego brat ukrywał przed nim pewien sekret. Wkrótce agenci wpadają trop przestępcy. Motywy jego działania okazują się niezwykle zaskakujące.(c)

programme.title: Largo (odc. 13)
programme.desc: Grupa Adriatycka zrzeszająca podejrzanych biznesmenów i polityków chce zdobyć władzę nad światem. Powstrzymać ich może tylko Largo Winch, szef jednej z największych i najbogatszych międzynarodowych spółek. W Monako Largo, Joy i Simon przypadkowo spotykają Vanessę, siostrę tego ostatniego. Kobieta ma przestępczą przeszłość, lecz wygląda na to, że się ustatkowała. Pracuje jako krupierka w kasynie swojego narzeczonego, magnata bankowego. Okazuje się, że mężczyzna jest kluczowym partnerem strategicznym w planach Grupy W.(c)

programme.title: Tajne akcje CIA (odc. 10)
programme.desc: Agencja Bezpieczeństwa Narodowego otrzymuje tajne informacje planach o zamachu na króla Arabii Saudyjskiej. Szukając spiskowców agenci Matt i Lisa trafiają na trop potężnej siatki terrorystycznej. Dzięki ich sprawnej i szybkiej akcji niedoszli sprawcy zostają ujęci. Tymczasem izraelski Mossad twierdzi, że jeden z pojmanych jest ich agentem. Matt doprowadza do uwolnienia agenta saudyjskiego z więzienia. Wkrótce odkrywa jednak, że został wprowadzony w błąd. Mossad oszukał CIA i brnie dalej w kłamstwa, usiłując na własną rękę wykryć i ukarać terrorystów.(n)

programme.title: Nieśmiertelny 2 (odc. 4)
programme.desc: Przygody szkockiego wojownika Duncana MacLeoda (Adrian Paul) z klanu Connorów. Tym razem nieśmiertelny będzie musiał stoczyć walkę nie tylko z innymi nieśmiertelnymi, lecz także poradzić sobie z tajemniczym stowarzyszeniem Obserwatorów, którego jednym z liderów jest Joe Dawson (Jim Byrnes). Członkowie zgromadzenia to śmiertelnicy, którzy śledzą nieśmiertelnych. W życiu MacLeoda pojawi się Amanda (Elizabeth Gracen), nieśmiertelna złodziejka, która od setek lat żyje na granicy prawa, Richie Ryan (Stan Kirsch), młody uczeń Duncana, oraz tajemniczy Methos (Peter Wingfield), najstarszy spośród wszystkich nieśmiertelnych.(c)

programme.title: Nieśmiertelny 2 (odc. 5)
programme.desc: Przygody szkockiego wojownika Duncana MacLeoda (Adrian Paul) z klanu Connorów. Tym razem nieśmiertelny będzie musiał stoczyć walkę nie tylko z innymi nieśmiertelnymi, lecz także poradzić sobie z tajemniczym stowarzyszeniem Obserwatorów, którego jednym z liderów jest Joe Dawson (Jim Byrnes). Członkowie zgromadzenia to śmiertelnicy, którzy śledzą nieśmiertelnych. W życiu MacLeoda pojawi się Amanda (Elizabeth Gracen), nieśmiertelna złodziejka, która od setek lat żyje na granicy prawa, Richie Ryan (Stan Kirsch), młody uczeń Duncana, oraz tajemniczy Methos (Peter Wingfield), najstarszy spośród wszystkich nieśmiertelnych.(c)

programme.title: Gliniarz z dżungli 2 (odc. 14)
programme.desc: Detektyw James Ellison (Richard Burgi) dysponuje szczególnymi umiejętnościami, które zyskał podczas służby w jednostce specjalnej na terenie w peruwiańskiej dżungli. Dzięki niezwykle wyostrzonym zmysłom jest niezrównany w walce z przestępczością na terenie Stanów Zjednoczonych. Pomaga mu student antropologii Blair Sandburg (Garett Maggart). Ellison bada okoliczności napadu połączonego z kradzieżą. Impreza urodzinowa pewnej Rosjanki zostaje przerwana przez brutalny atak dwóch mężczyzn. Niebawem znika walizka chłopaka jubilatki.(c)

programme.title: F/X (odc. 20)
programme.desc: Roland "Rollie" Tyler (Cameron Daddo) jest ekspertem od efektów specjalnych w branży filmowej. Jest mistrzem w tworzeniu iluzji. Wraz z przyjaciółmi potrafi przy pomocy zaawansowanej technologii zmienić wyobrażenie w rzeczywistość. Rollie właśnie pracuje na planie filmu gangsterskiego. Wkrótce jednak na jego drodze stają prawdziwi przestępcy, z którymi musi się zmierzyć. Serialowa wersja kinowych hitów "F/X" i "F/X 2" powstałych w latach 80. i 90. XX wieku, które zdobyły popularność dzięki dynamicznej akcji i imponującym efektom specjalnym.(n)

programme.title: Zła znajomość
programme.desc: Wdowa Susan Walker (Mercedes Ruehl) samotnie wychowuje dwójkę dzieci, dziesięcioletnią Hannah i młodszego Maksa. Pewnego razu poznaje przystojnego Russella (Alex Carter), który wydaje się jej doskonałym kandydatem na męża i ojca jej pociech. Troskliwy i opiekuńczy mężczyzna szybko zdobywa jej zaufanie i sympatię rodzeństwa. Gdy okazuje się, że zajmuje się on handlem narkotykami, zdesperowana Susan porzuca go, nie zważając na obietnice, że zerwie z nielegalnym procederem. Pewnego razu dom kobiety szturmuje policja, a ona zostaje aresztowana pod zarzutem współudziału w rozprowadzaniu marihuany. Podczas procesu koledzy Russella - udając współpracę z wymiarem sprawiedliwości, by w ten sposób uzyskać łagodniejszą karę - zeznają przeciwko niewinnej matce. W konsekwencji Susan zostaje skazana na dwudziestoletni pobyt w więzieniu. Rozpoczyna długoletnią walkę o anulowanie niesprawiedliwego wyroku.(c)

programme.title: Largo (odc. 14)
programme.desc: Zrzeszająca podejrzanych biznesmenów i polityków, z całego świata Grupa Adriatycką chce zdobyć władzę nad światem. Powstrzymać Grupę może tylko Largo Winch, szef jednej z największych i najbogatszych światowych spółek. Largo i Joy jadą na urlop do jednej z posiadłości Grupy W we Francji. W trakcie pikniku zauważają podejrzany samochód, wewnątrz którego znajduje się przerażony człowiek, kurczowo ściskający walizkę. Okazuje się, że jest to Claude Roux, który jechał na spotkanie z Largo. Ostatnim gestem umierającego jest przekazanie walizki Largo. Wkrótce nadjeżdża kolejne auto. Dochodzi do strzelaniny.(c)

programme.title: Ulice San Francisco 4 (odc. 12)
programme.desc: Czwarty sezon przygód pary niezwykłych detektywów z wydziału zabójstw. Doświadczony porucznik Mike Stone (Karl Malden)policjant z dwudziestoletnim stażem zawodowym, współpracuje z inspektorem Stevem Kellerem (Michael Douglas), który pod jego okiem zaznajamia się ze specyfiką pracy policyjnego śledczego. Wspólnie przemierzają niebezpieczne ulice San Francisco, tropiąc groźnych przestępców.(c)

programme.title: Wzór (odc. 4)
programme.desc: Nieuchwytna grupa rabuje banki - w ciągu ośmiu miesięcy udaje jej się ograbić aż 16 oddziałów. Charlie dokonuje wyliczeń, pozwalających wskazać bank, który będzie kolejnym celem złodziei. Gdy Don i jego ludzie próbują zatrzymać przestępców, dochodzi do strzelaniny. Ginie czworo ludzi, wśród nich agent FBI. Charlie jest załamany. Szuka zapomnienia w pracy - wraca do problemu matematycznego, który próbował rozwiązać, kiedy jego matka umierała na raka. Don potrzebuje jednak pomocy brata. Wciąż namawia go, by pomógł w rozwiązaniu tej trudnej sprawy.(c)

programme.title: Bunt maszyn
programme.desc: Wojskowy samolot rozbija się na jednej z tropikalnych wysp Pacyfiku. Okazuje się, że maszyna przewoziła nową, tajną broń opracowaną na zamówienie rządu USA - zabójcze roboty. Po katastrofie obdarzone sztuczną inteligencją monstra wymykają się spod kontroli twórców i przejmują władzę nad terytorium wyspy. Armia amerykańska wysyła na miejsce oddział komandosów, którym przewodzi major Richard Tunney (Joe Lando). Doskonale wyszkoleni specjaliści muszą dezaktywować zbuntowane maszyny. Żołnierze mogą także liczyć na wsparcie profesor Susan Foster (Lisa LoCicero). Nie ma jednak pewności, czy ludzie poradzą sobie z pancernymi i uzbrojonymi w nowoczesną broń robotami.(c)

programme.title: Transmorfersi
programme.desc: Przed kilkuset laty złowroga rasa kosmicznych robotów podbiła Ziemię. Obecnie niewielka grupa ocalałych rozpoczyna bunt przeciwko władzy maszyn.(c)

programme.title: Transmorfersi: Upadek ludzkości
programme.desc: Roboty z kosmosu pojawiają się na Ziemi, udając zwykłe urządzenia użytkowe. Ludzie podejmują z nimi walkę o przetrwanie.(n)

programme.title: Couples Who Kill
programme.desc: Documentary series about murderous partnerships. Jonathan and Jeremiah become friends in a special facility for the criminally insane. Will they act out their murderous fantasies when they are released?(c)

programme.title: Nightmare Next Door
programme.desc: Documentary series which tells the stories of people who have disappeared from their communities, only to be found brutally murdered by someone they knew. When Karin is found strangled to death in her flat, suspicion falls on her estranged husband. But it will take 26 years to solve this shocking case.(c)

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: True crime. A look at how the FBI used forensic evidence to solve the sexual assault and murder of a woman and her two daughters.(c)

programme.title: Stacey Dooley Investigates: New Drug Frontiers
programme.desc: Series in which Stacey Dooley investigates the new frontlines of the global war on drugs, heading to remote and hostile regions to meet producers, traffickers, the authorities, law enforcement agencies, and addicts and locals caught in the crossfire. Stacey travels to Ukraine to investigate the struggle to keep drugs out of the UK and reveals that drug cartels from South America have been using it as a transit hub to smuggle cocaine into western Europe. In Odessa, officials show her the tricks traffickers use to hide drugs within cargoes and she learns that customs officials are notoriously open to bribes. Stacey discovers that local drug users are resorting to horrific homemade substitutes including 'crocodile', so called because it rots the flesh of users and turns it scaly. Stacey meets young addicts as they make a batch from bleach, petrol and tablets. Learning they have only months to live, Stacey is also shocked to hear that police have recently found 'crocodile' in the UK.(n)

programme.title: The Truth About Magaluf: Stacey Dooley Investigates
programme.desc: Stacey Dooley travels to Magaluf, on the Spanish island of Mallorca, to get under the skin of this popular and notorious resort. The resort is famous for the drunken antics of the British tourists who go there, but Stacey wants to find out what it's like for the thousands of Spanish workers who serve, police and clear up. Working in a bar, Stacey is not only surprised to learn how much free alcohol is on offer to young British tourists, she's horrified when she witnesses the sexually explicit drinking games the drunk tourists are encouraged to play. When cleaning hotel rooms, not only does she learn about the vandalism and mess tourists leave behind, she meets one member of staff who's been left traumatised after he saw a young girl fall to her death at the hotel earlier this year. But it is when Stacey rides along with an ambulance crew and a police patrol car over a busy weekend that she discovers things are really getting out of control in Magaluf.(n)

A successful high-living yuppie has a side which he keeps hidden from his friends and colleagues - his appetite for sadistic violence, murder and the music of Phil Collins. However, his murderous impulses soon start intruding into his public life, as he tries to maintain a facade of normality.(c)

programme.title: Stacey Dooley Investigates: Coming Here Soon
programme.desc: Stacey Dooley travels to Greece, Ireland and Japan, three countries each facing very different and difficult economic challenges, to find out what it's like to be young and caught up in them. In Greece, her journey begins with a street tour of Athens where she quickly learns how badly affected normal Greeks are as she encounters scavengers, soup kitchens and witnesses a suicide attempt. Stacey's investigation continues with a look at how new charges for receiving even basic medical help are effectively denying many poor Greeks access to their national health service. She accompanies a group as it takes over an underground station in protest at recent price increases imposed on many public services and travels to the island of Chios to visit two former civil servants who have taken a gamble in an attempt to earn a living by setting up a snail farm. Finally, she attends a massive public demonstration gathered outside parliament that turns into a violent riot.(n)

programme.title: Cherry Healey: Like a Virgin

But good or bad, Cherry Healey wants to find out if that one simple little act really does have a lasting impact. From a girl's first time in the back of a Fiat Panda to a guy who has popped his cherry three times, Cherry looks for essential truths amongst the tales of sex and debauchery to see if losing your virginity is about more than just having sex for the first time.(n)

programme.title: Stacey Dooley Investigates: Coming Here Soon
programme.desc: Series in which Stacey Dooley looks at how the economic crisis has affected young people in three different countries and what lessons can be learnt for us back in the UK. When Stacey arrives in Dublin's Temple Bar the party is in full swing, but soon she stumbles across a group of young protesters angered by the mess they have inherited. Stacey explores the country's infamous property boom and discovers its dangerous and devastating consequences. She meets a group of young, first-time buyers whose dream homes turned out to be anything but, and is shocked to hear that they now face homelessness and bankruptcy. Stacey spends time with a girl in her twenties who is preparing to move to the other side of the world simply to find work. Since the recession hit, emigration figures have rocketed in Ireland and now almost 1,000 people a week are checking out. Is Ireland at risk of losing an entire generation and if things don't improve is this a trend we could see coming to Britain soon?(n)

programme.title: Inside the Vets

programme.title: Secrets of the Sales
programme.desc: With exclusive access to some of Britain's biggest high street chains, Cherry Healey goes behind the scenes to find out how the sales work from the inside. Cherry goes backstage in the John Lewis summer sale, gets inside a critical mark down meeting where sale prices and sale strategy are set, and she discovers the addictive way bargain hunting can affect our bodies. Cherry also uncovers hidden sales offering huge price cuts, learns how major high street retailers use scent to try and influence our behaviour, and meets with a sofa manufacturer willing to admit furniture sales can be a psychological trick.(c)

Katie says she is the grown up in the relationship and her fiance Steve is like a child. In the delivery suite, Steve is on form constantly mucking about and generally driving Katie up the wall. programme.title: Food Unwrapped
programme.desc: Jimmy Doherty, Kate Quilton and Matt Tebbutt present more of their favourite food investigations. Jimmy and Matt are braving the heat of chilli peppers, including some of the hottest in the world. Jimmy heads to South Africa on the trail of sweet piquanté peppers, and discovers a curious case of 'plant breeder's rights' - which allow companies to effectively 'own' a fruit or vegetable. Kate looks into Britain's plastic recycling crisis, and discovers one type of very common food packaging that can't be recycled, which one major supermarket has made plans to ditch. In Germany, Matt investigates a new type of yoghurt that claims to be full of fibre - but doesn't have any bits in it - and the secret involves chicory.(c)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Property series. Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer search for property in and around Bristol. Kirsty is with Craig and Rich who have been looking for a home for over a year. Phil helps Laura and Linda, a mother and daughter looking for a sound investment for the whole family.(c)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun
programme.desc: Property series. Natalie and Andy Ray met 13 years ago and have six children between them. The whole family has grown to love Florida for its fun-filled attractions and fantastic weather, and now this young-at-heart couple is looking for a future family holiday home there.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun
programme.desc: Property series with Jasmine Harman. Hyacinth Miller from London is looking to permanently relocate to Barbados. Jasmine shows her five properties in the south of the island.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Reality series in which bed-and-breakfast owners compete to have their establishments crowned the best. Mark and Kathy start the competition at their grandiose Godshill Park Farmhouse on the Isle of Wight and immediately their hosting skills come into question as Kathy asks Kalpana and Joseph from The Address to remove their shoes because of the cream carpets.(c)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Reality series in which bed-and-breakfast owners compete to have their establishments crowned the best. Mark and Kathy find two hairs in the bathroom, but Joseph and Kalpana are satisfied to see the correct amount of hangers and matching spoons. However, Cumbrian farmers Ruth and Mike are shocked to discover there's no view of the sea from their window.(c)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Reality series in which bed-and-breakfast owners compete to have their establishments crowned the best. The competition moves north to Blackpool to Kalpana and Joseph's four-star townhouse. Cumbrian farmers Ruth and Mike aren't best pleased to see a view of a car park and a security light outside their window. The group activity is a trip to the famous Pleasure Beach.(c)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Reality series in which bed-and-breakfast owners compete to have their establishments crowned the best. The group head to the Cumbrian hillsides to stay at Ruth and Mike's Crake Trees Manor. Teresa is looking forward to relaxing in the plush four-star gold B&B, but is in for a surprise when she learns where she and her husband Clive will spend the night.(c)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Reality series in which bed-and-breakfast owners compete to have their establishments crowned the best. With all of the visits completed, the rivals reconvene to find out how much they have been paid by their fellow proprietors. Mark and Kathy of Godshill Park Farm House discover some heavy underpayments, and while relations between the group and Teresa and Clive are shattered, accusations of game-playing fly between all the contestants.(c)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Dinner party reality show. First to host in Leicester is NHS manager Helen Mather, who keeps her menu simple so she can concentrate on entertaining her fellow guests with 'urban ballet'. Her fellow diners are cheeky software company manager Ryan Bruce, food snob and estate agent director Terry Robinson, glamorous beauty salon manager Porchia Lee and double glazing salesman Richard Deeping, who are joined by a rather unusual sixth 'person' at the dinner table.(c)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Cookery based reality programme. On day two in Leicester, estate agent Terry Robinson sets out to achieve a perfect score of forty out of forty with his "Dress as your hero" theme and Elton John influenced entertainment.(c)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Dinner party reality show. It's day three in Leicester and the turn of Beauty Spa manager Porchia Lee, who hosts a French themed dinner party. She cooks chicken liver pate, pan fried chicken with tarragon sauce and that French classic Crème Brulee, but can't help concentrating on herself rather than her cooking, and there's a disaster in every course including a pudding so bad her guests are reduced to tears.(c)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Dinner party reality show. Twenty-year-old ex-rugby player and IT geek Ryan Bruce hosts the fourth dinner party in Leicester, serving up an ambitious Spanish menu, which he boldly cooks in front of his guests. Entertainment comes courtesy of Ryan's sister, West End actress Charlie Bruce, who puts her brother and the guests through their paces in a salsa class.(c)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Reality series in which people compete to be the best dinner-party host. In Leicester double glazing salesman Richard Deeping hosts having already offended most of the group. He hopes to win them round with his passion for cooking and great food. His guests aren't expecting much, but then Richard's first course goes down so well he is overcome with emotion at the positive response! The food continues to impress, but when it's time for his choice of entertainment Richard reveals a saucy past.(c)

programme.title: Kirstie and Phil's Love It or List It
programme.desc: Property series in which Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer go head to head to persuade owners to sell their homes or give them a makeover. In Brixham, Northamptonshire, rugby-playing Ian wants to move out of the property that he and wife Sarah bought together just two years ago.(c)

programme.title: The Supervet
programme.desc: Documentary series following a vet and his team in one of the most advanced practices in Britain. Noel treats a dachshund who has a deformity in his foot. A ten-month-old Labrador needs a hip replacement before he can begin his training as a medical alert dog. An eight-year-old shih tzu requires an operation to fix her spine.(c)

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Series following Britain's most ambitious house-building projects. Andrew and Lowri Davies set out to build an environmentally friendly farmhouse in rural Wales. They opt for some state-of-the-art experimental building materials, but their builders do not seem to know how to use them. The budget spirals out of control and the couple find it hard to justify the expense.(c)

programme.title: Code 37: Sex Crimes
programme.desc: Belgian crime drama series following Hannah Maes, the head of the Ghent police department specialising in sexual offences. The hospital reports signs of sexual assault on a woman with learning disabilities who collapses at work. The police discover a suspicious letter. Meanwhile, Hannah asks her father about her brother, who has not been heard from for many years.(n)

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Documentary series following patients at the A&E department of King's College Hospital over a 24-hour period. This episode looks at the challenges that the King's staff face when patients arrive. While some have obvious symptoms, others initially baffle the medical team.(c)

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Documentary series following patients at the A&E department of King's College Hospital over a 24-hour period. This episode looks at 48-year-old Bobby, who has come to A&E suffering seizures, and is brought in by his partner Jackie. Bobby has spent most of his adult life in prison and recounts the story of his childhood and experience of being taken into care. Ronald, who was celebrating his 46th wedding anniversary to wife Carole, is brought in by paramedics with breathing problems. Meanwhile, seven-year-old Rienelle has fallen from a climbing frame.(c)

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Documentary series following patients at the A&E department of King's College Hospital over a 24-hour period. This episode looks at the challenges that the King's staff face when patients arrive. While some have obvious symptoms, others initially baffle the medical team.(c)

programme.desc: A special edition of the food investigation series that reveals the secrets of China's food. programme.title: Location, Location, Location

Her guests are Licia Snow, trainee solicitor Raphael Steele, bar manager Matt Wren and Swedish financial adviser Charlotte Sundberg.(c)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Dinner party competition. Pub manager and artist Matt Wren struggles with disasters in the kitchen on day two of the competition in south London. While Michelle and Licia argue, Raphael Steele finds himself charmed by Charlotte.(c)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Dinner party competition. Print manager and live wire Licia Snow is third to host in this new competition in south London. Licia plans a laid back evening with a few rustic and homely touches. But there is small chance of this the way she and Michelle bicker.(c)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Dinner party competition. Fourth to host in south London is Raphael Steele. It's Raphael's first ever dinner party and he plans some ackee, saltfish, curried goat, and a few other Caribbean favourites based on old family recipes, plus some steel drum music for entertainment.(c)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Cookery-based reality show in which amateur chefs compete for the title of ultimate dinner party host. programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Reality series in which B&B owners battle with other establishments for popularity. The show visits The Bell House Hotel in Wiltshire, where business partners Chris Williams and Jacqui Hogg hope guests will appreciate their attempts to bring London chic to the shires.(c)

programme.title: Four in a Bed

A communal bathroom has the guests lost for words and the lack of a hot breakfast included in the price leaves a bad taste in everyone's mouths.(c)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Reality series in which B&B owners battle with other establishments for popularity. A visit to Strawberry Gardens B&B in Heysham, where husband and wife team Susan and David Speak offer home-from-home accommodation with lashings of northern hospitality. Sports-nut David treats his guests to a traditional darts competition at his local snooker hall, adjudicated by former world champion, Alan Warriner-Little.(c)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Reality series in which B&B owners battle with other establishments for popularity. The show visits The Bateman's Mill near Chesterfield, where manager Jade Hendon and friend Diana Yates set out to be the best.(c)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Reality series in which B&B owners battle with other establishments for popularity. The Bell House is up first and owners Chris and Jacqui want to find out why Matthew marked them down for being too tall for his bed. Matthew and Paula want to tackle Jade and Diana's low score for their breakfast set up at The Partridge.(c)

programme.title: Emergency Helicopter Medics
programme.desc: Series following some of Britain's busiest air ambulance teams as they race to bring the hospital emergency department to the roadside. Cumbrian farmer Dennis is pierced in the chest by a large metal spike. Motorcyclist Ian is in a critical condition after a crash in the Lake District. And toddler Alistair is flown to a specialist burns unit after he is badly scalded.(c)

programme.title: Father Ted
programme.desc: Ecclesiastical comedy. When Polly Clarke, a writer of steamy novels, comes to stay on Craggy Island, Father Ted is unsure what she finds most attractive about him - his spirituality or his manly charm.(c)

programme.title: Father Ted
programme.desc: Award-winning sitcom. The trio take themselves off to their annual holiday at the Kilkelly Caravan Park. Unfortunately, the attractions - the Magic Road and St Kevin's Stump - are marred by a suspicious couple staying nearby and an over-excitable youth group.(c)

programme.title: Britain's Best Loved Sitcoms
programme.desc: First of a two-part series, narrated by Tamsin Greig, paying homage to the shows that have made us laugh out loud in our millions over the past half century. From modern hits like The Office, Twenty Twelve, Mrs Brown's Boys and Peep Show, all the way back to older classics such as The Likely Lads, Dad's Army and Steptoe and Son - via perennial favourites Blackadder, Only Fools and Horses and Fawlty Towers - which one will come out on top? Channel 4 commissioned a brand new poll of all age groups across the country to find out - with the results to be counted down to the nation's most revered sitcom of all. The programme features interviews with a host of famous faces from situation comedy, including Brendan O'Carroll, Richard Wilson, Tony Robinson, Ricky Tomlinson, Wendy Craig, Patricia Routledge, Leslie Ash and Alison Steadman, as well as some of the writers and producers. The countdown is packed with clips, facts and insights.(c)

programme.title: Escape to the Chateau
programme.desc: Series following Dick Strawbridge and his partner Angel Adoree as they restore their French chateau. Costs mean the couple must take up the renovation work themselves. They decide to buy some chickens to try and live as self-sufficiently as possible, but it's a different story with the heating and water. The chateau's windows are crumbling, and the list of problems is endless. The project has fallen massively behind schedule, especially as they plan to celebrate their wedding at the chateau in just a few months.(c)

programme.title: Run for Cover
programme.desc: Powerful action-packed Western starring James Cagney as Matt Dow, a wanderer accused of a crime he didn't commit. A shoot-up takes place in which his young companion's leg is smashed. When the townspeople realise they have made a terrible mistake, they appoint Dow their sheriff, and he in turn appoints his young crippled friend Davey his deputy. Davey's bitterness pulls the two apart, however, when he makes a deal with a gang of crooks.(c)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Cookery-based reality show. This week's competition is in the Vale of Aylesbury and first to host is Australian Natalie Dixon. Natalie is aiming to win the money with her Asian fusion menu, but with 74 year-old, traditional cabbie John Feore on the guest list, selling this kind of 'foreign' menu might prove difficult.(c)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Cookery-based reality show. In the Vale of Aylesbury 70-year-old cabbie John Feore treats his guests to a taste of Ireland, cooking a traditional roast with all the trimmings. The episode sees food regulation lawyer Greg Pearson infuriated by John's lack of Irish charm, sales manager Bekki Jones marvel at John's achievements, Australian Natalie Dixon despair at the delays, and football announcer Mike Botto being intrigued by John's youthful exploits.(c)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Cookery-based reality show. In Aylesbury, third to host is competitive sales manager Bekki Jones who is determined to win.(c)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Cookery-based reality show. This week's competition is in the Vale of Aylesbury and fourth to host is Greg Pearson, who is confident that his foodie knowledge will help triumph.(c)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Cookery-based reality show. In the Vale of Aylesbury football match announcer Mike Botto is hoping that his Italian-themed evening will see him score a winner. Mike goes all out to impress with his spaghetti Bolognaise, and he also ropes in a Pavarotti impersonator to sing for his guests. However not so impressed with the host's Italian heritage is Australian Natalie Dixon who reveals that, unlike Mike, she knows what she's talking about when it comes to Italy. Also, Mike has to deal with the fallout between foodie Greg Pearson and cabbie John Feore who have one final evening together after having clashed all week.(c)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Reality series in which B&B owners battle with other establishments for popularity. The group go head to head in a beat-boxing sound off before a champion is chosen. Old tensions surface at dinner and the hosts are left to diffuse an awkward stand-off. One of the guests takes issue with breakfast, leaving the hosts nervous for payment day.(c)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Reality series in which B&B owners battle with other establishments for popularity. It's the final day in the competition. Keats Cottage is up first, and owners David and Ewa Woodward want to challenge Martin's criticism over the way they run their business.(c)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: The cookery-based reality show in which five amateur chefs compete. This week's competition is in Boston, Lincolnshire and the first host to kick things off is 23 year-old trainee accountant Annika - a self-confessed hippy and hunter-gatherer. She might be young, but will her country fayre and love of game see her snag the cash prize? Joining her round the table are Carolyn, Adrian, Sylwia and Katy.(c)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: The cookery-based reality show in which five amateur chefs compete. Competitions fanatic Katy is convinced her organised approach will help her bag this week's cash prize. Farmer's wife Carolyn offers up a harsh critique as Katy's food fails to impress, with not even her 'prize-winning' savoury profiteroles winning over the guests.(c)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: The cookery-based reality show in which five amateur chefs compete. This week's competition is in Boston, Lincolnshire. Adrian is hoping his spicy food and surprises will help him bag the prize, although it could be those surprises that end up costing him first place. Last night Adrian kept quiet round the table, but tonight he's on the charm offensive. One guest that hasn't been impressed is keen foxhunter, Carolyn who does her best to trip Adrian up. Adrian's spicy food impresses the other guests, but his final surprise could be one step too far.(c)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: The cookery-based reality show in which five amateur chefs compete. In Boston Polish-born carer Sylwia is putting on a very European menu, hoping to charm with top notch cooking that takes her guests on a tour of all the places she's lived in the world. After jack-the-lad Adie managed to wow his guests with a surprisingly upbeat dinner party last night, Sylwia is hoping her European entertainment will also be a hit. But will the growing friction between Annika and Carolyn spoil the night?(c)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: It's the final night in Boston, and hard to please fox hunter Carolyn is planning on a charm offensive to win over the guests she's criticised all week.(c)

programme.title: The Secret Life of 4-Year-Olds
programme.desc: Observational documentary series which follows a group of four-year-old children as they meet for the first time. In the second episode, uncover a fascinating world of playground friendships, romances and rivalries. Self-proclaimed "geezer" Harper already has several girlfriends, but has eyes on new girl Ava. How will sassy and confident Ava react to his overtures? Harper's best friend Vinnie also has romance on his mind, but what happens to their bromance when they come to blows over a girl? Rory has grown up on a Welsh farm and won awards for his pet rams. After a difficult and tearful start at the nursery, can he find a friend with whom to share his love of sheep?(c)

programme.title: 999: On the Frontline
programme.desc: Documentary series filmed simultaneously with the ambulance crews of the West Midlands, shows the range of cases they deal with at the same time across different cities in the area. The air ambulance team rushes to save an elderly man who has fallen from a ladder. In Birmingham, a newly qualified paramedic struggles to treat an epileptic man in delirium. In Coventry, paramedics help a young girl who has passed out.(n)

programme.title: Inside Birmingham Children's Hospital
programme.desc: Documentary series following children and their families in Birmingham Children's Hospital, narrated by David Tennant. This episode follows three families dealing with difference. Seventeen-year-old Tijana considers a cosmetic eye, baby Lily is put forward for corrective surgery for a cleft lip and palate and teenager Ellie battles feelings of depression.(c)

programme.title: 999: What's Your Emergency?
programme.desc: Documentary series following emergency services at work in Wiltshire. Zero-hour contracts and long working hours leave many people wondering where the next pay cheque is coming from. With a rise in levels of stress and anxiety in the workplace, the emergency services are witnessing how modern life is literally killing us.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay helps out restaurants over the pond. The venue for this programme is The Secret Garden, a romantic French restaurant in the heart of Moorpark, California, run by French chef Michel Bardavid. But business is far from bon in this Gallic outpost where Michel's over-complicated cuisine is keeping the customers away. On the brink of bankruptcy, he needs drastic action to create a dramatic turnaround.(c)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay tries to fix failing restaurants. Lela's is a fine dining restaurant in Pomona, California, run by inexperienced owner Lela and young chef Ricky. The fatal combination of her ineptitude and his arrogance has resulted in a business so rocky that it's about to close down for good. Gordon's recipe for rescuing Lela's disastrous finances sets him on a collision course with the kitchen.(c)

Now ready to expand their family, they want a home in one of the priciest parts of the city. Phil must help the couple come to terms with the limitations of their budget.(c)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun
programme.desc: Property series. Scarlette Douglas shows mother and daughter Linnette and Sandra Genus five properties on the west coast of Florida for their budget of 160,000 pounds.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun
programme.desc: Property series. Geri Melville is originally from St Lucia, but moved to the UK when she was nine. Now ready to return to her roots with husband Ian, they have 360,000 pounds to spend on a holiday home together on the island. Laura Hamilton shows them what's on offer.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Reality series in which bed-and-breakfast owners compete to have their establishments crowned the best. First to host are husband-and-wife team Paul Billington and Flora Loizou from Silverwood Lodge in Cambridgeshire, who try to impress their three female guest competitors.(c)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Reality series in which bed-and-breakfast owners compete to have their establishments crowned the best. The group spend the evening in Sue's dog-friendly, and dog-themed, Seashells Guesthouse in Great Yarmouth. Spirits are high during the afternoon as the guests experience some local beachside fun, but the mood changes at dinner when Nancy brings up the controversial issues of dogs sleeping in the beds and Sue allowing smoking in the bedrooms.(c)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Reality series in which bed-and-breakfast owners compete to have their establishments crowned the best. American ex-banker Nancy Hampson hosts at The Old Court Guesthouse. After showing her guests around Bath and for a dip in a thermal spa, Nancy takes them to a quirky local restaurant.(c)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Reality series in which bed-and-breakfast owners compete to have their establishments crowned the best. Caroline is the host at The Dean Bed and Breakfast on the Firth of Forth, where her opening gambit is a jig accompanied by a bagpiper.(c)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Reality series in which bed-and-breakfast owners compete to have their establishments crowned the best. It is the final day and the hosts gather to find out how much they have been paid and who is taking the title of the best value for money establishment. Paul and Flora from Silverwood Lodge are fired up about Nancy's comments, while Sue from Seashells has an axe to grind with Nancy.(c)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Cookery-based reality show. First to host in Salisbury is Natasha Conti, who's laying on a 'summer fete', complete with crazy prizes.(c)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Cookery-based reality show. Farm manager Sophie McConnell plans pig racing as part of the entertainment on her night as host in Salisbury - and her home grown cow Levi for the main course.(c)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Dinner party reality programme. Former army major Anthony Brown-Hovelt is serving a worldly mix of dishes on his night in Salisbury, including Uzbekistani food and porridge ice cream. Chris comes dressed up as an American sailor. But Natasha doesn't find this as appealing as he'd hoped. And Anthony struggles to convince some of the group of his psychic talents.(c)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Dinner party reality programme. Cost conscious Chris Hiller plans an eclectic menu for his night in Salisbury that includes chicken a l'orange and peppers stuffed with baked beans. He's hoping the total cost of the meal for five will be just 18 pounds and even plans on watering down the wine. Is this any way to win Natasha's affections?(c)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Dinner party reality programme. The last host in Salisbury is part-time care worker Jane Arnold, who plans an English menu sourced from the great Wiltshire outdoors.(c)

programme.title: Kirstie and Phil's Love It or List It
programme.desc: Property series in which Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer go head to head to persuade owners to sell their homes or give them a makeover. Kirstie and Phil are in Northamptonshire with Isabel and Louis Prat, whose 30 years of marital bliss is being shaken by their house. The couple are desperate to enjoy their retirement in their dream home. However, Isabel hates their current place, while Louis loves both it, and the local area, with a passion. With a healthy refurb budget of 70,000 pounds, Kirstie feels confident she can give Isabel the fabulous ground floor space she wants.(c)

programme.title: The Supervet
programme.desc: Series following vet Noel Fitzpatrick and his team in one of the most advanced veterinary practices in Britain. Noel Fitzpatrick and the team at Fitzpatrick Referrals have to deal with two emergency cases. Lara the cat went missing after jumping into a removal van. She escaped, only to be hit by a car and then attacked by a fox. Her rear leg is shattered and Noel has to perform reconstructive surgery to rebuild it. Chief, an eight-year-old Northern Inuit dog, dislocated his hip while chasing a fox. Noel thinks he needs hip replacement surgery, but Chief's owner, Nigel, is unable to pay for the operation and wants Noel to put Chief down. And Bertie, a 12-year-old spaniel, and Noel's colleague Susan's dog, is going lame and Susan wants Noel to fix his ruptured ligaments.(c)

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Series following householders who are on a mission to completely re-design and redecorate their homes from top to bottom. Jim and Simone Fairfull are planning a spectacular, light-filled pavilion floating over a private loch in Scotland.(c)

programme.title: Nazi Treasure Hunters
programme.desc: Documentary series on Hitler's attempts to illegally acquire the world's greatest art collection. Hitler personally oversaw the theft of art treasures from across Europe. A team of art historians try to uncover these stolen pieces and trace them back to their rightful owners. In the US, a holocaust survivor narrates how a special unit of Jewish prisoners at Auschwitz were forced to collect gold wedding rings and teeth fillings from the Jews who were murdered at the camp. In the mountains of Bavaria, treasure hunters search for the missing gold that was hidden by SS troops at the end of the war.(c)

programme.title: Hitler's Hidden Drug Habit: Secret History
programme.desc: Documentary which sheds new light on Adolf Hitler's health and extraordinary medicinal regime during World War II, based on a secret American intelligence dossier and the medical diaries and journals of Dr Theodor Morell, Hitler's personal physician. Locked away since 1945, the diaries reveal that, far from being a picture of robust health, Hitler was a nervy hypochondriac. They also chart Hitler's descent into illness and drug dependency, as he used uppers and downers, quack cures, powerful stimulants and multiple injections for various real or imagined ailments. The programme also contains revelatory film footage that the German censors tried to suppress, and which suggests that by 1945 Hitler was in an advanced stage of a serious degenerative disease.(n)

programme.title: My Big Fat Gypsy Holiday
programme.desc: Special edition of the reality series following gypsies and Irish Travellers as they prepare for the most amazing trips of their lives. From the bride preparing to go away to Mexico for her honeymoon to an eight-year-old girl planning a religious pilgrimage to Bosnia, and the Romany gypsy brothers on a lads trip in Tenerife, the show reveals that for members of travelling communities getting away is about far more than just sun, sea and sequins.(c)

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Documentary series following patients at the A&E department of King's College Hospital over a 24-hour period. This episode shows how a trip to A&E acts as a long overdue wake-up call for Malcolm, who's 56.(c)

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown
programme.desc: Jimmy Carr hosts another edition of the comedy quiz show. Jon Richardson and Joe Lycett take on Sean Lock and Michelle Wolf, with Adam Riches in Dictionary Corner alongside Susie Dent and Rachel Riley.(c)

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats
programme.desc: Jimmy Carr is joined by team captains Sean and Jon for an episode of best bits from the last series. Among the guests featured in this show are Jack Dee, Claudia Winkleman, Danny Dyer, Joe Wilkinson and Alex Jones.(c)

programme.title: Food Unwrapped
programme.desc: Jimmy Doherty, Kate Quilton and Matt Tebbutt present more of their favourite food investigations. Jimmy and Matt are braving the heat of chilli peppers, including some of the hottest in the world. Jimmy heads to South Africa on the trail of sweet piquanté peppers, and discovers a curious case of 'plant breeder's rights' - which allow companies to effectively 'own' a fruit or vegetable. Kate looks into Britain's plastic recycling crisis, and discovers one type of very common food packaging that can't be recycled, which one major supermarket has made plans to ditch. In Germany, Matt investigates a new type of yoghurt that claims to be full of fibre - but doesn't have any bits in it - and the secret involves chicory.(c)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Property series. Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer search for property in and around Bristol. Kirsty is with Craig and Rich who have been looking for a home for over a year. Phil helps Laura and Linda, a mother and daughter looking for a sound investment for the whole family.(c)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun
programme.desc: Property series. Natalie and Andy Ray met 13 years ago and have six children between them. The whole family has grown to love Florida for its fun-filled attractions and fantastic weather, and now this young-at-heart couple is looking for a future family holiday home there.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun
programme.desc: Property series with Jasmine Harman. Hyacinth Miller from London is looking to permanently relocate to Barbados. Jasmine shows her five properties in the south of the island.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Reality series in which bed-and-breakfast owners compete to have their establishments crowned the best. Mark and Kathy start the competition at their grandiose Godshill Park Farmhouse on the Isle of Wight and immediately their hosting skills come into question as Kathy asks Kalpana and Joseph from The Address to remove their shoes because of the cream carpets.(c)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Reality series in which bed-and-breakfast owners compete to have their establishments crowned the best. B and B beginners Teresa and Clive host at the Butterfly Guest House in Porthcawl, South Wales. Mark and Kathy find two hairs in the bathroom, but Joseph and Kalpana are satisfied to see the correct amount of hangers and matching spoons. However, Cumbrian farmers Ruth and Mike are shocked to discover there's no view of the sea from their window.(c)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Reality series in which bed-and-breakfast owners compete to have their establishments crowned the best. The competition moves north to Blackpool to Kalpana and Joseph's four-star townhouse. Cumbrian farmers Ruth and Mike aren't best pleased to see a view of a car park and a security light outside their window. The group activity is a trip to the famous Pleasure Beach.(c)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Reality series in which bed-and-breakfast owners compete to have their establishments crowned the best. The group head to the Cumbrian hillsides to stay at Ruth and Mike's Crake Trees Manor. Teresa is looking forward to relaxing in the plush four-star gold B&B, but is in for a surprise when she learns where she and her husband Clive will spend the night.(c)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Reality series in which bed-and-breakfast owners compete to have their establishments crowned the best. With all of the visits completed, the rivals reconvene to find out how much they have been paid by their fellow proprietors. Mark and Kathy of Godshill Park Farm House discover some heavy underpayments, and while relations between the group and Teresa and Clive are shattered, accusations of game-playing fly between all the contestants.(c)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Dinner party reality show. First to host in Leicester is NHS manager Helen Mather, who keeps her menu simple so she can concentrate on entertaining her fellow guests with 'urban ballet'. Her fellow diners are cheeky software company manager Ryan Bruce, food snob and estate agent director Terry Robinson, glamorous beauty salon manager Porchia Lee and double glazing salesman Richard Deeping, who are joined by a rather unusual sixth 'person' at the dinner table.(c)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Cookery based reality programme. On day two in Leicester, estate agent Terry Robinson sets out to achieve a perfect score of forty out of forty with his "Dress as your hero" theme and Elton John influenced entertainment.(c)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Dinner party reality show. It's day three in Leicester and the turn of Beauty Spa manager Porchia Lee, who hosts a French themed dinner party. She cooks chicken liver pate, pan fried chicken with tarragon sauce and that French classic Crème Brulee, but can't help concentrating on herself rather than her cooking, and there's a disaster in every course including a pudding so bad her guests are reduced to tears.(c)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Dinner party reality show. Twenty-year-old ex-rugby player and IT geek Ryan Bruce hosts the fourth dinner party in Leicester, serving up an ambitious Spanish menu, which he boldly cooks in front of his guests. Entertainment comes courtesy of Ryan's sister, West End actress Charlie Bruce, who puts her brother and the guests through their paces in a salsa class.(c)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Reality series in which people compete to be the best dinner-party host. In Leicester double glazing salesman Richard Deeping hosts having already offended most of the group. He hopes to win them round with his passion for cooking and great food. His guests aren't expecting much, but then Richard's first course goes down so well he is overcome with emotion at the positive response! The food continues to impress, but when it's time for his choice of entertainment Richard reveals a saucy past.(c)

programme.title: Kirstie and Phil's Love It or List It
programme.desc: Property series in which Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer go head to head to persuade owners to sell their homes or give them a makeover. In Brixham, Northamptonshire, rugby-playing Ian wants to move out of the property that he and wife Sarah bought together just two years ago.(c)

programme.title: The Supervet
programme.desc: Documentary series following a vet and his team in one of the most advanced practices in Britain. Noel treats a dachshund who has a deformity in his foot. A ten-month-old Labrador needs a hip replacement before he can begin his training as a medical alert dog. An eight-year-old shih tzu requires an operation to fix her spine.(c)

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Series following Britain's most ambitious house-building projects. Andrew and Lowri Davies set out to build an environmentally friendly farmhouse in rural Wales. They opt for some state-of-the-art experimental building materials, but their builders do not seem to know how to use them. The budget spirals out of control and the couple find it hard to justify the expense.(c)

programme.title: Code 37: Sex Crimes
programme.desc: Belgian crime drama series following Hannah Maes, the head of the Ghent police department specialising in sexual offences. The hospital reports signs of sexual assault on a woman with learning disabilities who collapses at work. The police discover a suspicious letter. Meanwhile, Hannah asks her father about her brother, who has not been heard from for many years.(n)

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Documentary series following patients at the A&E department of King's College Hospital over a 24-hour period. This episode looks at the challenges that the King's staff face when patients arrive. While some have obvious symptoms, others initially baffle the medical team.(c)

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Documentary series following patients at the A&E department of King's College Hospital over a 24-hour period. This episode looks at 48-year-old Bobby, who has come to A&E suffering seizures, and is brought in by his partner Jackie. Bobby has spent most of his adult life in prison and recounts the story of his childhood and experience of being taken into care. Ronald, who was celebrating his 46th wedding anniversary to wife Carole, is brought in by paramedics with breathing problems. Meanwhile, seven-year-old Rienelle has fallen from a climbing frame.(c)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay helps out ailing restaurants across the pond. The Mixing Bowl, a bijou diner in Bellmore, New York, is run by talented chef Billy with his wife Lisa and their manager Mike. Despite Billy's flair in the kitchen, the business is haemorrhaging money via Mike's out-of-control marketing plans.(c)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay helps out restaurants across the pond. Gordon Ramsay visits the Seascape restaurant in the seaside village of Islip in Long Island, New York, where in the kitchen the walls are hidden in layers of grease so thick they need to be scraped clean.(c)

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Documentary series following patients at the A&E department of King's College Hospital over a 24-hour period. This episode looks at the challenges that the King's staff face when patients arrive. While some have obvious symptoms, others initially baffle the medical team.(c)

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats: Uncut

programme.title: Kirstie's Handmade Treasures
programme.desc: Crafts series. Kirstie Allsopp competes in the afternoon tea tent at the Devon County Show. What will the judges think of her scones and unconventional kumquat eclairs?(c)

programme.title: Food Unwrapped: China Special
programme.desc: A special edition of the food investigation series that reveals the secrets of China's food. Jimmy Doherty and Matt Tebbutt sample extraordinary and exotic dishes, meet the skilled workers working in small cooperatives, and witness a blend of ancient farming techniques and commercial production on an epic scale. Back in the UK, Kate Quilton seeks out the mysterious origins of fortune cookies. Kate and Jimmy find out exactly what bamboo shoots are, and why they cost so much.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun
programme.desc: Property series. Ben Hillman helps Glasgow couple Maureen and Steve Smith find a holiday home in Orlando, Florida where they can escape the Scottish winters.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun
programme.desc: Property series. Mohammad and Salma Aslam from south London have family with a holiday home on Spain's Costa del Sol, and having spent so many good times there, are now determined to buy one of their own.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Property series. Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer visit Croydon. Kirstie helps friends Joe, Will and Joe get their feet on the London property ladder. Phil meets newlyweds Leon and Cherrelle, who've been living with granny while saving a deposit and are looking for somewhere affordable with space to start a family.(c)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Property series. In Nottingham, the local property market currently finds the demand for homes far outweighing supply. Kirstie Allsopp helps Brett and Jo by trying to open their eyes to wider options across the city. Phil Spencer is with first-time buyers Ben and Pip, who have their hearts set on a trendy part of town where properties are scarce and the competition is tight.(c)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Dinner party competition. First to host in south London is divorce lawyer Michelle Camacho, who plans a seventies menu including duck a l'orange, 'psychedelic coleslaw', groovy veg and bloody Mary sorbet. Her guests are Licia Snow, trainee solicitor Raphael Steele, bar manager Matt Wren and Swedish financial adviser Charlotte Sundberg.(c)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Dinner party competition. Pub manager and artist Matt Wren struggles with disasters in the kitchen on day two of the competition in south London. While Michelle and Licia argue, Raphael Steele finds himself charmed by Charlotte.(c)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Dinner party competition. Print manager and live wire Licia Snow is third to host in this new competition in south London. Licia plans a laid back evening with a few rustic and homely touches. But there is small chance of this the way she and Michelle bicker.(c)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Dinner party competition. Fourth to host in south London is Raphael Steele. It's Raphael's first ever dinner party and he plans some ackee, saltfish, curried goat, and a few other Caribbean favourites based on old family recipes, plus some steel drum music for entertainment.(c)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Cookery-based reality show in which amateur chefs compete for the title of ultimate dinner party host. Last to host in south London is Swedish businesswoman Charlotte Sundberg, who reckons a night of schnapps, Swedish folk song singing and some classic Swedish cuisine might just win her the prize.(c)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Reality series in which B&B owners battle with other establishments for popularity. The show visits The Bell House Hotel in Wiltshire, where business partners Chris Williams and Jacqui Hogg hope guests will appreciate their attempts to bring London chic to the shires.(c)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Reality series in which B&B owners battle with other establishments for popularity. The second visit of the week is to the Partridge in Oxfordshire, where young couple Matthew Cockman and Paula Szkwarkowska hope guests will get on board with their passion for local organic food. A communal bathroom has the guests lost for words and the lack of a hot breakfast included in the price leaves a bad taste in everyone's mouths.(c)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Reality series in which B&B owners battle with other establishments for popularity. A visit to Strawberry Gardens B&B in Heysham, where husband and wife team Susan and David Speak offer home-from-home accommodation with lashings of northern hospitality. Sports-nut David treats his guests to a traditional darts competition at his local snooker hall, adjudicated by former world champion, Alan Warriner-Little.(c)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Reality series in which B&B owners battle with other establishments for popularity. The show visits The Bateman's Mill near Chesterfield, where manager Jade Hendon and friend Diana Yates set out to be the best.(c)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Reality series in which B&B owners battle with other establishments for popularity. It's the final day in the competition and the B&B owners are meeting for the last time to find out what they've been paid and to settle some scores. The Bell House is up first and owners Chris and Jacqui want to find out why Matthew marked them down for being too tall for his bed. Matthew and Paula want to tackle Jade and Diana's low score for their breakfast set up at The Partridge.(c)

programme.title: Emergency Helicopter Medics
programme.desc: Series following some of Britain's busiest air ambulance teams as they race to bring the hospital emergency department to the roadside. Cumbrian farmer Dennis is pierced in the chest by a large metal spike. Motorcyclist Ian is in a critical condition after a crash in the Lake District. And toddler Alistair is flown to a specialist burns unit after he is badly scalded.(c)

programme.title: Father Ted
programme.desc: Ecclesiastical comedy. When Polly Clarke, a writer of steamy novels, comes to stay on Craggy Island, Father Ted is unsure what she finds most attractive about him - his spirituality or his manly charm.(c)

programme.title: Father Ted
programme.desc: Award-winning sitcom. The trio take themselves off to their annual holiday at the Kilkelly Caravan Park. Unfortunately, the attractions - the Magic Road and St Kevin's Stump - are marred by a suspicious couple staying nearby and an over-excitable youth group.(c)

programme.title: Britain's Best Loved Sitcoms
programme.desc: First of a two-part series, narrated by Tamsin Greig, paying homage to the shows that have made us laugh out loud in our millions over the past half century. From modern hits like The Office, Twenty Twelve, Mrs Brown's Boys and Peep Show, all the way back to older classics such as The Likely Lads, Dad's Army and Steptoe and Son - via perennial favourites Blackadder, Only Fools and Horses and Fawlty Towers - which one will come out on top? Channel 4 commissioned a brand new poll of all age groups across the country to find out - with the results to be counted down to the nation's most revered sitcom of all. The programme features interviews with a host of famous faces from situation comedy, including Brendan O'Carroll, Richard Wilson, Tony Robinson, Ricky Tomlinson, Wendy Craig, Patricia Routledge, Leslie Ash and Alison Steadman, as well as some of the writers and producers. The countdown is packed with clips, facts and insights.(c)

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown
programme.desc: Jimmy Carr hosts another edition of the comedy quiz show. Jon Richardson and Jonathan Ross take on Lee Mack and Victoria Coren Mitchell. Jessie Cave is in Dictionary Corner alongside Susie Dent and Rachel Riley.(c)

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown
programme.desc: Jimmy Carr hosts another edition of the comedy quiz show. Sean Lock and Stephen Mangan take on guest captain Richard Ayoade and Katherine Ryan. Bill Bailey is in Dictionary Corner with Susie Dent, while Rachel Riley is in charge of the letters and numbers.(c)

programme.title: Father Ted
programme.desc: Ecclesiastical comedy. When Polly Clarke, a writer of steamy novels, comes to stay on Craggy Island, Father Ted is unsure what she finds most attractive about him - his spirituality or his manly charm.(c)

From modern hits like The Office, Twenty Twelve, Mrs Brown's Boys and Peep Show, all the way back to older classics such as The Likely Lads, Dad's Army and Steptoe and Son - via perennial favourites Blackadder, Only Fools and Horses and Fawlty Towers - which one will come out on top?
